content:
Rate Control

Rate control using beta blockers or calcium channel blockers is recommended for patients with a fib and RVR who do not undergo cardioversion 5, 6.
Studies have shown that diltiazem, metoprolol, and verapamil are effective for rate control, with no significant difference in achieving rate control between these agents 7, 8.
However, diltiazem may achieve rate control faster than metoprolol, and clinicians should consider individual patient factors when selecting a medication 7.

Special Considerations
query: beta-blockers rate control atrial fibrillation metoprolol propranolol heart rate ventricular response
title: How do we treat atrial fibrillation (a fib) with rapid ventricular response (RVR)?
reference: Dr.Oracle Medical Advisory Board & Editors. (2025). How do we treat atrial fibrillation (a fib) with rapid ventricular response (RVR)? Retrieved June 14, 2025, from Dr.Oracle website.
